org.tinfour.demo.utils

Class TestOptions

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.tinfour.demo.utils.TestOptions

  • public class TestOptions
extends Object
    Provides a convenience utility for extracting command-line arguments for running integration tests.

    The intent of this class is to provide a uniform treatment of command-line arguments. It also provides a way of discovering command-line arguments that are not recognized by the application. This situation sometimes occurs when the operator makes a typographical error in the specification of arguments.

    • Nested Class Summary

    • Method Detail

      • scanIntOption

        public Integer scanIntOption(String[] args,
                             String option,
                             boolean[] matched,
                             Integer defaultValue)
                      throws IllegalArgumentException
        Search the arguments for the specified option followed by a integer value, marking the matched array if it is found.
        Parameters:
        args - a valid array of arguments.
        option - the target command-line argument (introduced by a dash)
        matched - an array parallel to args used to indicate which arguments were identified by the scan operation.
        defaultValue - a default value to be returned if the option is not found, or a null if none is supplied.
        Returns:
        if found, a valid instance of Integer; otherwise, a null.
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException

      • scanBooleanOption

        public Boolean scanBooleanOption(String[] args,
                                 String option,
                                 boolean[] matched,
                                 Boolean defaultValue)
        Scans the argument array to see if it included the specification of a boolean option in the form "-Option" or "-noOption". Note that boolean arguments are single strings and do not take a companion argument (such as "true" or "false").
        Parameters:
        args - a valid array of command-line arguments
        option - the target option
        matched - an array paralleling args to indicate whether the args matched a search option.
        defaultValue - a default value to be returned if the option is not found, or a null if none is supplied.
        Returns:
        if found, a valid instance of Boolean; otherwise, a null.

      • scanStringOption

        public String scanStringOption(String[] args,

                               boolean[] matched)

        Parameters:

        option - the target command-line argument (introduced by a dash)
        matched - an array parallel to args used to indicate which arguments were identified by the scan operation.
        Returns:
        if found, a valid string; otherwise, a null.
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException

        Parameters:
        args - a valid array of arguments.
        option - the target command-line argument (introduced by a dash)
        matched - an array parallel to args used to indicate which arguments were identified by the scan operation.
        Returns:
        if found, a valid array of 4 floating-point values; otherwise, an empty array

      • argumentScan

        public boolean[] argumentScan(String[] args)
        Scan the argument list, extracting standard arguments. A boolean array with a one-to-one correspondence to args[] is returned indicating which arguments were recognized.
        Parameters:
        args - a valid, potentially zero-length argument list.
        Returns:
        a boolean array indicating which arguments were recognized.

      • getInputFileRootString

        public String getInputFileRootString()
        Gets the root string for the input file, removing the file-type suffix from the end of the string. This method is intended for use in applications where the output file has the same root name as the input file, but a different file-type suffix is appended.
        Returns:
        if the input file is specified, a valid string; otherwise, a null.

        Parameters:
        defaultCount - the default number of rows; supply an impossible value if no default is available.
        Returns:
        if specified, the value from the "-nRows" argument; otherwise, the default.

        Parameters:
        defaultSeed - a default value .
        Returns:
        if specified, the value from the "-seed" argument; otherwise, the default.

        Parameters:
        args - a valid array of arguments

      • checkForMandatoryOptions

        public void checkForMandatoryOptions(String[] args,
                                     String[] options)

      • getLidarClass

        public int getLidarClass()
        Gets the target lidar classification for samples to be read from an LAS file. This setting is sometimes combined with the lidar thinning setting.
        Returns:
        a value in the range 0 to 255, or -1 for all classes.

      • getLidarReturn

        public String getLidarReturn()
        Gets a string indicating whether lidar data should be selected based on return and, if so, whether first or last return should be used.
        Returns:
        if specified, either "First" or "Last"; otherwise, a null.

      • setLidarClass

        public void setLidarClass(int classification)
        Set the default classification for lidar points to be accepted when reading a LAS file. Use 2 for ground points and -1 to accept all.
        Parameters:
        classification - an integer in the range 0 to 255, or -1 for all.

      • getLidarThinningFactor

        public double getLidarThinningFactor()
        Gets a lidar thinning factor used for selecting random subsets of lidar samples from an LAS file. If used, the number of points retrieved from the file will be reduced to a count approximately proportional to the thinning factor. For example, given a thinning factor of 0.5, approximately 1/2 of the sample points in the lidar file will be retrieved. This setting is often compiled with the lidar-class setting.
        Returns:
        a value greater than zero and less than or equal to 1.0, with 1.0 corresponding to 100 percent acceptance.

      • getClipBounds

        public double[] getClipBounds()
        Get the clip bounds specified as a sequence of 4 floating-point values giving minX, maxX, minY, maxY.
        Returns:
        if specified, a valid array of 4 values; otherwise a zero-length array
